TableField.name: FileRetentionID
TableField.phrase: Record ID|An automatically assigned number used to associate physical file retention methods and start dates with physical files

TableField.name: FileReqID
TableField.phrase: File Requirement|A combined field used to describe this file requirement when associating it with other records

ForeignField.name: OrganizationID
ForeignField.phrase: Policy Organization|The organization responsible for establishing and monitoring record retention policies throughout the enterprise

ForeignField.name: Organization
ForeignField.phrase: Policy Organization|The organization responsible for establishing and monitoring record retention policies throughout the enterprise

ForeignField.name: PersonAccountableID
ForeignField.phrase: Person Accountable|The name of the person responsible for records retention and disposal

ForeignField.name: PersonAccountable
ForeignField.phrase: Person Accountable|The name of the person responsible for records retention and disposal

ForeignField.name: FileTypeID
ForeignField.phrase: File Type|A combined field used to describe this file type when associating it with other files

ForeignField.name: FileCategoryID
ForeignField.phrase: Category|A broad categoy used to group files of similar types

CodeField.name: FileCategory
CodeField.phrase: Category|A broad categoy used to group files of similar types

ForeignField.name: FileType
ForeignField.phrase: File Type|A combined field used to describe this file type when associating it with other files

ForeignField.name: FileRetentionMethod
ForeignField.phrase: Retention Requirement|The specific method utilized to retain physical files of module records of the stated organization
ForeignField.sample: Locked filing cabinet within a locked room

ForeignField.name: FileRetentionDesc
ForeignField.phrase: Retention Requirement Description|A detailed description of the file retention requirements associated with this module or type of information
ForeignField.sample: Corrective action file retention is required by law in the US for 10 years from the date of file creation. Internal requirements extend this retention period to 12 years. The only exception is our California facilities where the retention requirement is 15 years post file creation date.

ForeignField.name: FileRetentionPeriod
ForeignField.phrase: Retention Period|The amount of time a physical file must be retained before disposal or archival

ForeignField.name: FileRetentionUnitsID
ForeignField.phrase: Term Units|The units associated with the retention period

ForeignField.name: FileRetentionUnits
ForeignField.phrase: Term Units|The units associated with the retention period

ForeignField.name: FileDispositionMethod
ForeignField.phrase: Disposition Requirement|The file disposition method following the expiration of the retention period
ForeignField.sample: Locked filing cabinet within a locked room

ForeignField.name: FileDispositionDesc
ForeignField.phrase: Disposition Requirement Description|A detailed description of the file disposition requirements associated with this module or type of information
ForeignField.sample: Corrective action files shall be incinerated after seven years.

ForeignField.name: FileReq
ForeignField.phrase: File Requirement|A combined field used to describe this file requirement when associating it with other records

RemoteField.name: PhysicalFileStartDate
RemoteField.phrase: File Start Date|The date the physical file associated with the record was stated

TableField.name: Original
TableField.phrase: Original File|Whether the file is the original file consisting of original documentation

CalculatedField.name: PhysicalFileDispositionDate
CalculatedField.phrase: File Disposition Date|The actual or projected disposal date of the physical file associated with the record

CalculatedField.name: DaysRemaining
CalculatedField.phrase: Days Remaining|The total number of days remaining before the phyisical file should be disposed of in accordance with the disposition policy

TableField.name: FilingOrganizationID
TableField.phrase: Filing Organization|The name of the organization where the physical file is located

ForeignField.name: FilingOrganization
ForeignField.phrase: Filing Organization|The name of the organization where the where the physical file is located

RemoteField.name: LocationID
RemoteField.phrase: File Location|Specific area within the facility where the physical file is located

ForeignField.name: Location
ForeignField.phrase: File Location|Specific area within the facility where the physical file is located

RemoteField.name: FilingPersonAccountableID
RemoteField.phrase: Person Accountable|The name of the person responsible for records retention and disposal

ForeignField.name: FilingPersonAccountable
ForeignField.phrase: Person Accountable|The name of the person responsible for records retention and disposal

RemoteField.name: FileSubjectID
RemoteField.phrase: File Subject|The name of the individual, when applicable, that is the subject of the physical file

ForeignField.name: FileSubject
ForeignField.phrase: File Subject|The name of the individual, when applicable, that is the subject of the physical file

TableField.name: FileName
TableField.phrase: File Name|A short title or phrase used to identify the physical file

TableField.name: FileNumber
TableField.phrase: File Number|A number manually assigned to a file for tracking purposes

TableField.name: FilingMethodID
TableField.phrase: Filing Method|The specific method utilized to retain the physical file

CodeField.name: FilingMethod
CodeField.phrase: Filing Method|The specific method utilized to retain the physical file
CodeField.sample: Locked filing cabinet within a locked room

TableField.name: FilingMethodDesc
TableField.phrase: Filing Method Description|A detailed description of the file retention method associated with this record
TableField.sample: Corrective action file retention is required by law in the US for 10 years from the date of file creation. Internal requirements extend this retention period to 12 years. The only exception is our California facilities where the retention requirement is 15 years post file creation date.

TableField.name: FilingDispositionID
TableField.phrase: Disposition Method|The file disposition method following the expiration of the retention period

CodeField.name: FilingDisposition
CodeField.phrase: Disposition Method|The file disposition method following the expiration of the retention period

TableField.name: FilingDispositionDesc
TableField.phrase: Disposition Method Description|A detailed description of the file disposition requirements associated with this module or type of information
TableField.sample: Corrective action files shall be incinerated after seven years.

TableField.name: PhysicalFileStatusID
TableField.phrase: File Status|The current status of the physical file associated with the record

CodeField.name: PhysicalFileStatus
CodeField.phrase: File Status|The current status of the physical file associated with the record

CombinedField.name: SystemNumber
CombinedField.phrase: System Number|A unique number assigned to the phisical file based on a combination of fields from within the file retention module. The system number is comprised of the filing organization ID, the filing location ID, the file type ID and the record retention ID

CombinedField.name: RecordLabel
CombinedField.phrase: Record Label|The short, concise, label of the record for display purposes

CombinedField.name: FileRetention
CombinedField.phrase: Record Description|A summary of the physical file record

SampleItem.name: Manufacturing Line 1, Production Building, Processing Room

ViewScreen.name: View
ViewScreen.phrase: View|View summary information about the physical file

EditScreen.name: Form
EditScreen.phrase: Form|Edit summary information about the physical file

SampleItem.name: Manufacturing Line 1, Production Building, Processing Room

EditScreen.name: Audits
EditScreen.phrase: Audits|Associate audits with the physical documentation file

EditScreen.name: BusinessContinuity
EditScreen.phrase: Continuity|Associate business continuity requirements with the physical documentation file

EditScreen.name: Responsibilities
EditScreen.phrase: Responsibilities|Associate responsibilities with the physical documentation file

EditScreen.name: Accountability
EditScreen.phrase: Accountability|Associate participants with ongoing accountabilities for the physical documentation file

EditScreen.name: Involvement
EditScreen.phrase: Involvement|Associate participants involved with the physical documentation file

EditScreen.name: BestPractices
EditScreen.phrase: Best Practices|Associate best practices with the physical documentation file

DocumentationSection.title: Introduction
DocumentationSection.p: The installation-specific introduction to the scope and purpose of this module should be entered here. You can click the online documentation link beneath the table of contents to see what the active agenda community has said to introduce this module. You are welcome to collect the thoughts of the community, copy them into your local documentation, and extend them to satisfy your local needs.

DocumentationSection.title: Implementation
DocumentationSection.p: Installation-specific implementation rules, policies, practices should be entered here. You can click the online documentation link beneath the table of contents to see what the active agenda community has said about implementating this module. You are welcome to collect the thoughts of the community, copy them into your local documentation, and extend them to satisfy your local needs.

DocumentationSection.title: People Elements
DocumentationSection.p: Installation-specific information regarding the way this module impacts people should be entered here. You can click the online documentation link beneath the table of contents to see what the active agenda community has said about how this module impacts, or is impacted by, people in general. You are welcome to collect the thoughts of the community, copy them into your local documentation, and extend them to satisfy your local needs.
